162F3443D94840168027368C7713572E.description:
investigate and compare how animals and plants undergo a series of orderly
changes in their diverse life cycles such as tomato plants, frogs, and lady beetles.

58E2D6C2D00042CD83E525ED3B00D7FC.description:
explore how structures and functions of plants and animals allow them to survive
in a particular environment; and

A4BEC3265D314DDD85E9802AE22A84D6.description:
Organisms and environments. The student knows that organisms undergo similar life
processes and have structures that help them survive within their environments. The
student is expected to:

4ADD4DC7AB7242A28523A119C3B74418.description:
describe environmental changes such as floods and droughts where some
organisms thrive and others perish or move to new locations.

9D36DB7A01C448AA8293AB67335196FC.description:
identify and describe the flow of energy in a food chain and predict how changes
in a food chain affect the ecosystem such as removal of frogs from a pond or bees
from a field; and

74B33FBC39F54098B0E42FB2E87E9033.description:
observe and describe the physical characteristics of environments and how they
support populations and communities of plants and animals within an ecosystem;

4AFA21B6DA0A492EB4E70B1DB4CCB293.description:
Organisms and environments. The student knows and can describe patterns, cycles,
systems, and relationships within the environments. The student is expected to:

3AB1547E357A4E0895D3B2FBC1864E5C.description:
identify the planets in Earth's solar system and their position in relation to the
Sun.

51CED363B0CA40D4B44284F77EC580D6.description:
construct models that demonstrate the relationship of the Sun, Earth, and Moon,
including orbits and positions; and

7D38405C47A044B18FAFA39F029D7E1F.description:
describe and illustrate the Sun as a star composed of gases that provides light and
thermal energy;

56DB52523A404C7B85FAEE61D5E5D35C.description:
Earth and space. The student knows there are recognizable patterns in the natural world
and among objects in the sky. The student is expected to:

617B842F65B64E0A82A4F8628630F58F.description:
explore the characteristics of natural resources that make them useful in products
and materials such as clothing and furniture and how resources may be
conserved.

FECEDC1063C44348B007FFC52B5DAD2D.description:
investigate rapid changes in Earth's surface such as volcanic eruptions,
earthquakes, and landslides; and

ECADEFF0DC4A4462AC12244E6B25CADF.description:
explore and record how soils are formed by weathering of rock and the
decomposition of plant and animal remains;

7D3F5691EF7C4EA4ACDFBC69CFDD90D6.description:
Earth and space. The student knows that Earth consists of natural resources and its
surface is constantly changing. The student is expected to:

26B3011581ED4CD29ECDFF26C4C9E49C.description: observe forces such as magnetism and gravity acting on objects.

76B5A25F5DCD491180DF558692209CF0.description:
demonstrate and observe how position and motion can be changed by pushing
and pulling objects such as swings, balls, and wagons; and

F22676F4A71A44318CE159A4D2C77DF8.description:
explore different forms of energy, including mechanical, light, sound, and
thermal in everyday life;

20B991EDAFC346E2BB552C305B337A13.description:
Force, motion, and energy. The student knows that forces cause change and that energy
exists in many forms. The student is expected to:

CA7E8DB0BBFA4934BC27F60D8453208D.description:
explore and recognize that a mixture is created when two materials are combined
such as gravel and sand or metal and plastic paper clips.

20164AEAB87A48249E4FD99F35D98E7E.description:
predict, observe, and record changes in the state of matter caused by heating or
cooling such as ice becoming liquid water, condensation forming on the outside
of a glass of ice water, or liquid water being heated to the point of becoming
water vapor; and

493183F216F04CE68111F2BF54FD4D41.description:
measure, test, and record physical properties of matter, including temperature,
mass, magnetism, and the ability to sink or float;

26CFDA700B934B3E99D4C55EEE124FE2.description:
Matter and energy. The student knows that matter has measurable physical properties and
those properties determine how matter is classified, changed, and used. The student is
expected to:

6D9F8F96A2D445A68B1473CBD533E103.description:
Scientific investigation and reasoning. The student knows how to use a variety of tools
and methods to conduct science inquiry. The student is expected to
collect, record, and analyze information using tools, including cameras,
computers, hand lenses, metric rulers, Celsius thermometers, wind vanes, rain
gauges, pan balances, graduated cylinders, beakers, spring scales, hot plates,
meter sticks, magnets, collecting nets, notebooks, and Sun, Earth, and Moon
system models; timing devices; and materials to support observation of habitats
of organisms such as terrariums and aquariums.

A079F564A0D04BC687F0DAD4CF78EA4F.description:
connect grade-level appropriate science concepts with the history of science,
science careers, and contributions of scientists.

D5B563475BE241BE9FA612FDE322C20A.description:
represent the natural world using models such as volcanoes or the Sun, Earth, and
Moon system and identify their limitations, including size, properties, and
materials; and

A2B47F62FF9C43699969E8310A068374.description:
analyze, evaluate, and critique scientific explanations by using evidence, logical
reasoning, and experimental and observational testing;

EC0074C96F9441CD95CD65BF138B2078.description:
Scientific investigation and reasoning. The student knows that information, critical
thinking, scientific problem solving, and the contributions of scientists are used in
making decisions. The student is expected to:

568183F9FDC8483BA85DA0D6F803C6A4.description:
communicate valid conclusions supported by data in writing, by drawing
pictures, and through verbal discussion.

630D2CD37A254A52BFE767D6E00CC007.description:
demonstrate that repeated investigations may increase the reliability of results;
and

401B2825E64C411E943E81587AC0AA0A.description:
analyze and interpret patterns in data to construct reasonable explanations based
on evidence from investigations;

4BEA43EDF85243C3A3F3DFFA5EE982B3.description:
construct maps, graphic organizers, simple tables, charts, and bar graphs using
tools and current technology to organize, examine, and evaluate measured data;

898113AC606C42F6A0B32D50E6B772ED.description:
collect and record data by observing and measuring using the metric system and
recognize differences between observed and measured data;

13407CFF9D4840E28DCF36D8AC44EECD.description:
Scientific investigation and reasoning. The student uses scientific practices during
laboratory and outdoor investigations. The student is expected to:

7D9B6CDE5BC343CCB1955F8CBCCD92AC.description:
make informed choices in the use and conservation of natural resources by
recycling or reusing materials such as paper, aluminum cans, and plastics.

1F7CD802C6514FFBA4470328CA65C4EE.description:
demonstrate safe practices as described in Texas Education Agency-approved
safety standards during classroom and outdoor investigations using safety
equipment as appropriate, including safety goggles or chemical splash goggles,
as appropriate, and gloves; and

59CD6E5F029E4A809BEA78927C929BB6.description:
Scientific investigation and reasoning. The student conducts classroom and outdoor
investigations following home and school safety procedures and environmentally
appropriate practices. The student is expected to:
